title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.1 HEALTH EMERGENCY

description.narrative: Output 1.1 More children, adolescents and their mothers affected by health outbreaks access timely and quality lifesaving health and nutrition interventions., which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more vulnerable neonates, infants and children survive and thrive and fewer women die during pregnancy and childbirth

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.1 More children, adolescents and their mothers affected by health outbreaks access timely and quality lifesaving healthand nutrition interventions.

description.narrative: Despite a challenging year, UNICEF supported authorities in both North and South to maintain the continuity of services during an ongoing COVID 19 pandemic at the Primary Health Care (PHC) level. Four rounds of Integrated Outreach (IOR) sessions were conducted to ensure equitable access to basic and essential health services, including maternal, newborn care, and health education and provision of IMCI supplies at the health facility level. Two;rounds of Polio (OCV) campaign were conducted. Resistance of authorities for door-to-door Polio vaccination in addition to a reluctance to accept covid vaccine remained major challenges. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2022
